suggestions: 1. Confidential Information.  “Confidential Information” is defined, collectively, as all information conveyed to the Receiving Party or its Representatives (as defined below) regarding the Disclosing Party, its affiliates, its subsidiaries or the potential Transaction, in whatever form, whether oral, electronic or written (provided that all written documents containing such information are clearly marked as “Confidential” or with a similar legend prior to disclosure under this Agreement, and for information disclosed orally or visually, the Disclosing Party shall provide the Receiving Party with a written summary of such information, similarly marked, within 30 days of disclosure), and including all notes, analyses, compilations, studies, forecasts, projections, records, interpretations, memoranda, reports or other documents, data, writings and records prepared by or on behalf of the Receiving Party or its Representatives which contain, reflect, are based upon, or are otherwise generated from such information, in whole or in part. Confidential Information also includes the following: (i) that the Disclosing Party is considering the potential Transaction, (ii) that discussions or negotiations have taken, are taking or may take place concerning the potential Transaction, (iii) any of the terms, conditions or other facts with respect to the potential Transaction, including, without limitation, the status of the potential Transaction, (iv) the existence and terms of this Agreement and (v) the fact that Confidential Information has been or may be made available to the Receiving Party and its Representatives. Confidential Information shall not include information that (i) is already in the Receiving Party’s or its Representatives’ possession from a source other than the Disclosing Party so long as that information was not disclosed in violation of an obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party, (ii) is or becomes available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the Receiving Party or its Representatives, (iii) is or becomes available to the Receiving Party or its Representatives on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the Disclosing Party or its Representatives, provided that the source of such information did not disclose such information in violation of an obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party, or (iv) the Receiving Party can clearly demonstrate was independently developed by the Receiving Party or its Representatives without use of the Confidential Information. The Receiving Party shall have no obligation to protect any information that is not identified as Confidential Information in accordance with this paragraph.
originalTexts: 1. Confidential Information.  “Confidential Information” is defined, collectively, as all information conveyed to the Receiving Party or its Representatives (as defined below) regarding the Disclosing Party, its affiliates, its subsidiaries or the potential Transaction, in whatever form, whether oral, electronic or written, whether or not marked or otherwise identified as confidential, and including all notes, analyses, compilations, studies, forecasts, projections, records, interpretations, memoranda, reports or other documents, data, writings and records prepared by or on behalf of the Receiving Party or its Representatives which contain, reflect, are based upon, or are otherwise generated from such information, in whole or in part. Confidential Information also includes the following: (i) that the Disclosing Party is considering the potential Transaction, (ii) that discussions or negotiations have taken, are taking or may take place concerning the potential Transaction, (iii) any of the terms, conditions or other facts with respect to the potential Transaction, including, without limitation, the status of the potential Transaction, (iv) the existence and terms of this Agreement and (v) the fact that Confidential Information has been or may be made available to the Receiving Party and its Representatives. Confidential Information shall not include information that (i) is already in the Receiving Party’s or its Representatives’ possession from a source other than the Disclosing Party so long as that information was not disclosed in violation of an obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party, (ii) is or becomes available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the Receiving Party or its Representatives, (iii) is or becomes available to the Receiving Party or its Representatives on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the Disclosing Party or its Representatives, provided that the source of such information did not disclose such information in violation of an obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party, or (iv) the Receiving Party can clearly demonstrate was independently developed by the Receiving Party or its Representatives without use of the Confidential Information.
